message: There are billions of new Django packages getting created every day. But the page above makes it seem like there aren't very many Django packages.
Maybe we should hack into the site with chainsaws :)
I submitted djangopackages there but it is not yet showing up. Emailed a bunch of people, twittered it, IRC'd it. And put it on convore. Any more ideas where to advertise this issue?
+1 @issackelly.  Justin and Jacob did most of the work on that.
pydanny justinlilly and jacobian own that page, AFAIK
Unfortunately Justin is in the middle of a cross-country move and Jacob is bouncing around the world at the moment, so you'll probably have to wait a few days to get either of their attention
On the plus side it looks like most of the work is happening at https://github.com/jacobian/djangoproject.com
This suggests they know they have to offload some of the work: https://github.com/jacobian/djangoproject.com/commit/ce959eb267f5f2b20bb58ce0d1365e62f1ba9893
you can probably just make a fork with your changes and make a pull request

I've just fixed it. Apparently there where *two* feeds added to the community section, on to the links section, one to the packages section. The first was using the rss feed, the latter the atom feed. The atom feed was not recognized for some reason.
s/on to the links section/one in the links section/
I've removed the duplicate aggregator entry and moved the correct one to the packages section.
Thanks @jezdez. Next time I'll file a ticket as you specified
@jezdez Thanks a million.  Yes, we promise to open tickets for these sorts of requests in the future, apologies
